instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA? This is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad. Each CD3215 in the system needs to be functioning in order for any of them to speak to the charger and negotiate receiving 20v from the charger rather than the default 5v that a USB-C charger puts out before communicating with the system. .
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power.

It looks that it had a  small liquid contact on the left USB-C ports.

It puls 5.12V and 0.33A on all USB-C  ports, but on UB300 port it only puls 0.16A.

UB300 seamed to be a bit burnt, and so I've replaced it but with the same result.

<SIGNAL>USBC_TA_CC1</SIGNAL>/2 seams to be ok, and have 0.564 on diode reading.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> has 1.898V and 0.398 on diaode reading

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Check LDO voltages for all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
Also compare diode mode readings.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi, 

I suppose that there is something wrong with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL>, but it looks that that's not all. Nothing else seams to be shorted, but not sure why there are other 0V voltages, and the bad readings on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>. I guess that I might have damaged <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> when replacing UB300...

UB300:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> = 0.184V and 0.002 on diode reading and 1.1 ohm resistance to ground
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.493 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.458  on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.482 on diode reading

UB400 (only has voltage with on side of charger):
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO</SIGNAL> = 3.285V and 0.508 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA</SIGNAL> = 1.802V and 0.524 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD</SIGNAL> =1.786V and 0.483  on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.502 on diode reading

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> = 2V and 0.512 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA</SIGNAL> = 1.803V and 0.526 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> = 1.8V and 0.489  on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.520 on diode reading

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> = 3.342V and 0.512 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA</SIGNAL> = 1.805V and 0.527 on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD</SIGNAL> = 1.797V and 0.486  on diode reading
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> = 0V and 0.518 on diode reading

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> = 0.184V and 0.002 on diode"
Check CB308, UB090 and UB300.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

CB308  was shorted. After removed it, now it puls 20.5V but 0A, and on  UB400  port it has a black ampmeter

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL>  also has 3.3V now.

Should I replace UB400?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: Compare CC1/2 diode mode readings between UB400 and other ports.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi

UB400 CC1 reading was bad and so Ii replaced UB400.
It solved the problem.

TKS
